content.raw:
The original [PR](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-gazebo/pull-requests/174/acropolis-add-contact-sensor/diff#chg-src/systems/contact/Contact.cc) has them being passed by value. Not sure where/when they were changed to `const &`. 

> Wouldn't using const & and removing the std::move result in the same number of copies as passing by non-const value and then moving?

I think clang-tidy recommends passing by copy followed by a move because it avoids an extra construction if the passed in value is already an rvalue. Won't make much of a difference here because `Load` is only called once. I'm okay either way.
content.html:
The original PR has them being passed by value. Not sure where/when they were changed to const &.

Wouldn't using const & and removing the std::move result in the same number of copies as passing by non-const value and then moving?

I think clang-tidy recommends passing by copy followed by a move because it avoids an extra construction if the passed in value is already an rvalue. Won't make much of a difference here because Load is only called once. I'm okay either way.
